Blood Products
Flow Chart for Warfarin Reversal

PCC is prescribed generally to rapidly reduce INR to less than or equal to 1.5 in a patient on Warfarin who is actively bleeding or requires an invasive procedure or surgery within 6 hours.  Plasma should not be prescribed before or after PCC

PCC is contraindicated in the following conditions:  1. Disseminated intravascular coagulopathy or coagulopathy from severe liver disease  2. Recent Heparin induced thrombocytopenia (PCC products contain heparin)

Reversal of Anti Factor Xa Inhibitor

PCC use is off-label for patients on Anti-Xa inhibitors (apixaban, edoxaban, rivaroxaban) and is associated with thrombotic risk, therefore consider patient bleeding and thrombosis risks.  Consider expert consultation for guidance
